_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A description of your facility and the regulated substances handled.



The Monument Butte Compressor Station is a Natural Gas Liquids (NGL) extraction, storage and load out process unit located near Myton, Utah. It is Ovintiv, Inc.'s policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws. The purpose of this Risk Management Plan is to provide information about operations at the facility, programs to prevent accidental chemical releases, emergency response plans in the event of an accidental release, the five-year accident history of the facility, and planned changes to improve safety at the facility.



The facility consists of a single 24,500-gallon tank, which is filled to a maximum of 80% capacity. The tank contains a mixture of methane, ethane, propane, butane, pentane, isobutane, and isopentane. The facility consists of separation and dehydration equipment, condensate storage areas, and compressor buildings used for treatment and compression of gas for sale.  As part of the Monument Butte compressor station operation, the facility handles -two EPA/RMP-covered flammable substances in quantities greater than the threshold quantity of 10,000 lbs. The Monument Butte compressor station does not have any EPA/RMP-regulated toxic chemicals. The facility is regulated under EPA Risk Management Program 40 CFR Part 68 - Program Level 1 requirements.



This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  In the event of a leak or overflow, all valves associated with that portion of the system will be closed and the system shut down to prevent additional releases while response procedures are initiated.  When a spill occurs outside of the containment, or in the event of a large or catastrophic release, personnel must take the necessary precautions to contain the spill to the site.  Immediate notification to designated Ovintiv Inc personnel is mandated and is the key to effective spill and release c

ontainment and control.  Such notification also allows the company to promptly report a spill event to appropriate government agencies, in accordance with applicable regulatory requirements.



Five-year accident history:



The Monument Butte Compressor Station has not had an accident in the last five years that caused onsite or offsite deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.



The emergency response program:



The facility will continue to coordinate any emergency response actions necessary with the Duchesne County Fire & Emergency Management Office. Ovintiv, Inc. employees are trained with the expectation that they will evacuate and restrict access to the facility until both the safety and exposure potentials are no longer a threat. All employees are trained to discover releases and take no further action beyond making notification. As appropriate other LEPC and other coordinating agencies and local hospitals may be involved. 



The Gas Services Coordinator is responsible for coordinating emergency actions, and essential planning for effectively protecting workers, the public, and the environment during emergency situations.



Planned changes to improve safety.

No changes to improve safety are planned at this time.
